message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.AR, cs.OS, cs.DB. 

This paper discusses security mechanisms for Non-Volatile Memories (NVMs), which are commonly studied in the computer security (cs.CR) and distributed systems (cs.DC) sub-categories. The paper also addresses the challenges of writing overhead and recovery time, which are important metrics for evaluating persistent memory systems, indicating a potential fit for the computer architecture (cs.AR), operating systems (cs.OS), and databases (cs.DB) sub-categories.
